title: U.S. to Exempt Certain Foreign Air Travelers From Covid-19 Vaccine Rules
sub_head: Children, people from countries with low vaccine supplies to be exempt from vaccination requirements, Biden administration says
body:
Children and those from countries with low supplies of Covid-19 vaccines will be exempt from new requirements that foreign nationals show proof of vaccination to fly to the U.S., the Biden administration said Monday.
The exceptions were outlined as the administration provided new details of its plans to reopen international travel in the midst of the pandemic, following pressure from European officials and major airlines.Â The administration in September said new vaccination requirements for foreign nationals would replace a series of limits on travel from Europe, China, Iran, Brazil, South Africa and India.
